definition: president (of a country)/same as 總統|总统
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
always/to assemble/gather/total/overall/head/chief/general/in every case
to gather/to unite/to unify/whole

sentences.english: And this president has even approved names of American citizens on that list.
sentences.chinese: 而且這個大總統甚至把一些美國公民也列入名單。

sentences.english: Guards watch one document, only know that the ordinary people dress was president.
sentences.chinese: 衛兵一看證件，才知道這個普通着裝的人竟是大總統。

sentences.english: This palace was now the home of President Yuan.
sentences.chinese: 這座宮殿現在成爲袁大總統的官邸。

sentences.english: After the victory of the Revolution, Dr. Sun Yat-sen as the provisional president.
sentences.chinese: 辛亥革命勝利後，孫中山當了臨時大總統。

definition: United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
Treaty of Shimonoseki (1895), concluding the First Sino-Japanese War 甲午戰爭|甲午战争[Jia3 wu3 Zhan4 zheng1]
Soviet (council)
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
to vow before one's troops
Manchukuo
to sacrifice one's life
Japanese Kwantung army (or Kantō army), notorious for numerous atrocities in China during WWII
Korean War (1950-1953)
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
Yang Hucheng (1893-1949), Chinese warlord and Nationalist general
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
the Mukden or Manchurian Railway Incident of 18th September 1931 used by the Japanese as a pretext to annex Manchuria/also known as Liutiaogou incident 柳條溝事變|柳条沟事变
the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
leadership authority
(military) Chief of Staff
